curated_text: Symbol: ADBE. Year: 2024. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: Figma, Adobe, Shah, the U.S., District Court, the “Shah Action, Gervat, Court, Gervat Actions, the “Consolidated Derivative Action, California Superior Court, the Consolidated Derivative Action, The Derivative Actions, the Securities Action, Board of Directors, the Securities Exchange Act, the Gervat Action, Adobe’s, the Shah Action, the Derivative Actions, Issuance Date Due Date Effective Interest Rate, The Revolving Credit Agreement, the Revolving Credit Agreement, SOFR, Unaudited, the Revolving Credit Agreement,, Commercial Paper Program, Term Loan Credit Agreement, the “Term Loan Credit Agreement, the Term Loan Credit Agreement, ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, SEC, BUSINESS OVERVIEW Adobe, APAC, Digital Media, Digital, Adobe Express, AI, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Stock, Behance, DDOM, ARR, Digital Media ARR, the Adobe Experience Platform, • Data, Adobe Analytics, Customer Journey Analytics, Customer Data Platform, Adobe Experience, Adobe Commerce, Adobe Campaign, Adobe Target. Context excerpt: competition from Figma and the adequacy of Adobe’s existing offerings to counter harms Adobe may have faced due to Figma’s growing market position were materially false and misleading. The Securities Action seeks unspecified compensatory damages, attorneys’ fees and costs, and extraordinary equitable and/or injunctive relief. On November 16, 2023, a shareholder derivative action captioned Shah v. Narayen et al, Case No. 1:23-cv-01315, was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware (the “Shah Action”), purportedly on behalf of Adobe. On January 3, 2024, a second shareholder derivative action captioned Gervat v. Narayen et al, Case No. 1:24-cv-00006, was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware (the “Gervat Action”), purportedly on behalf of Adobe. On January 24, 2024, the Court consolidated the Shah and Gervat Actions (together, the “Consolidated Derivative Action”). On January 18, 2024, a shareholder derivative action captioned Sbriglio v. Naraye
